metadata.title: CVE-2023-40303 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU inetutils through 2.4 may allow privilege escalation because ofunchecked return values of set*id() family functions in ftpd, rcp, rlogin,rsh, rshd, and uucpd. This is, for example, relevant if the setuid systemcall fails when a process is trying to drop privileges before letting anordinary user control the activities of the process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

inetutils-ftp - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-ftpd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-inetd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-ping - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-syslogd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-talk - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-talkd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-telnet - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-telnetd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-tools - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
inetutils-traceroute - 2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1
telnet - 0.17+2.4-2ubuntu1.1
telnetd - 0.17+2.4-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: inetutils package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1').
inetutils package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.4-2ubuntu1.1').
